nodes.bodyText: Pls use File.deleteOnExit() to remove the jar file after the test is finished.
Note try {} finally should be used to ensure deleteOnExit() is called even if something goes wrong.
Or call deleteOnExit() before writing to the file.
The jar file is generated temporarily inside .../openj9/test/TKG/test_output_xxxx (xxxx means random digits) which should be cleaned up by the test framework.
There is a helper that does this, can you use org.openj9.test.util.VersionCheck.major() instead?
Replaced with VersionCheck.major() and verified locally with internal JDK8, OpenJDK Java 11 and 14.
There is a JarOutputStream constructor that doesn't take a manifest. Can it be used instead to simplify the test?
Since the only change here is a copyright update, this change can be removed.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,7 +1,7 @@
 <?xml version="1.0"?>
 
 <!--
-  Copyright (c) 2016, 2019 IBM Corp. and others
+  Copyright (c) 2016, 2020 IBM Corp. and others

nodes.bodyText: Agreed and removed the copyright change in this build,xml

nodes.bodyText: If it is 8+, we do not need this subsets at all. By default, it is 8+
Removed the subset as suggested above.
